NoteLiteral.En:
Entry requirements: 
•	Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
•	B2 level of English language proficiency.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).
Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.
Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.

Description.En: This micro-module will introduce the students to the concepts of entity relationship modeling. After completing the micro-module, students will be able to analyze and define entities that compose a chosen domain and develop an entity relationship model using Unified Modeling Language. The developed models can be used as a generalized list of concepts of a domain or be used as a basis for database development.

NoteLiteral.En: Ability to analyse and define entities and relations that compose a chosen domain.
Ability to develop entity relationship models using Unified Modelling Language class notation.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
In this micro-module you will be provided with video lectures, self-control tests and personal tasks. The study course will last for 4 weeks. During this time, you will be developing entity relationship model on your selected domain. To complete this micro-module, you will have to present a developed entity relationship model and pass the exam.

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M107&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)

The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.

After the successful completion of the micro-module:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
Defining entities and their interactions are essential in understanding the scope and relations existing in the given domain

Communication and clear understanding of domain structure is important in any field. To achieve this development of diagrams and models is required. This micro-module will provide skills and competences required to develop entity relationship diagrams and use them in domain analysis.

Entry requirements:

- Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).  

Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.  

Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.
